derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French lampreie, from medieval Latin lampreda, probably from Latin lambere 'to lick' + petra 'stone' (because the lamprey attaches itself to stones by its mouth)

means.word_mean: 1. primitive eellike freshwater or anadromous cyclostome having round sucking mouth with a rasping tongue
